summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with multiple counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of minors, and sex trafficking conspiracy. The document details her alleged role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of at least four minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between 1994 and 2004. This is a superseding indictment (S2 20 Cr. 330) filed against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing charges of conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, sex trafficking of a minor, and perjury. It outlines specific overt acts involving Minor Victim-4 and cites false statements Maxwell made during a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with multiple counts related to conspiring with and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls. The indictment details her alleged role in recruiting, grooming, and participating in the abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier who sexually abused minor girls. The indictment describes him as the principal abuser, with Maxwell facilitating his access to victims.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: A minor recruited between 2001-2004 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, and who was also encouraged to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and filed the superseding indictment.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; were closest associates and intimate partners from approximately 1994 to 1997. Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his properties and conspired with him to entice and traffic minors for sexual abuse.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties between approximately 1994 and 2004.
Maxwell met, befriended, groomed, and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, starting when the victim was approximately 14 years old.
Maxwell interacted with and groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico in 1996, including providing an unsolicited topless massage.
Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.
Maxwell met, groomed, and facilitated the abuse of Minor Victim-4 at Epstein's Palm Beach residence starting when the victim was approximately 14, including scheduling appointments and paying her.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1, with Maxwell's facilitation, in New York and Florida.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 during massages that Maxwell encouraged.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-4 during paid nude massages at his Palm Beach residence.

events.title: Beginning of Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges the conspiracy between Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein to sexually exploit minors began at least in or about 1994.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein befriended, groomed, and sexually abused Minor Victim-1, starting when she was approximately 14. This included group sexual encounters in New York and Florida.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch, taking her to a movie and shopping, and providing an unsolicited topless massage as part of grooming.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, leading to sexual abuse.

events.title: Sex Trafficking Scheme in Palm Beach
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein recruited, paid, and sexually abused Minor Victim-4 and other minors at the Palm Beach residence, creating a network of underage victims. Victims were paid to recruit others.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell repeatedly provided false and perjurious statements under oath during a civil deposition regarding her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Filing of Superseding Indictment
events.description: The U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York files a superseding indictment (S2 20 Cr. 330) against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell recruited Minor Victim-4 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, paid her cash, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

events.title: Gift Sent to Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein caused a package (including lingerie) to be sent via Federal Express from Manhattan to Minor Victim-4's residence in Florida.

events.title: Maxwell's First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme to recruit underage girls and could not recall interacting with anyone under 18 at Epstein's properties other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, unaware he had sexual activities with others besides her and two other women, and that she never gave anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the legal case)
Palm Beach Residence (Epstein's residence in Florida)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually exploit and abuse multiple minor girls as young as 14 years old between 1994 and 2004.
The indictment details Maxwell's specific grooming methods: befriending victims, normalizing sexual conduct, undressing in front of them, and being present for or participating in sexual abuse.
Maxwell allegedly facilitated abuse at multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and her own London residence.
The charges include a sex trafficking conspiracy (2001-2004) where Maxwell and Epstein paid victims and encouraged them to recruit other underage girls for abuse.
Maxwell is accused of lying under oath during a 2016 civil deposition in an effort to conceal her crimes.
Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiracy, sex trafficking of a minor (specifically involving a victim under 16), and two counts of perjury.
The indictment details a pattern where Maxwell and Epstein recruited 'Minor Victim-4' between 2001-2004, paid her for sex acts, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Evidence includes the sending of gifts (like lingerie) from New York to the victim in Florida, demonstrating interstate activity.
Maxwell is accused of lying under oath in 2016 by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and denying she gave massages.
The filing includes forfeiture allegations for property used in or derived from the sex trafficking offense.
